wikipedia_page.main: George Walters VC (15 September 1829 – 3 June 1872) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * George Walters, born 15 September 1829 in Newport Pagnell, won the Victoria Cross at the Battle of Inkermann (where he was a Sergeant with the 49th Regiment of Foot) on 5 November 1854, by saving the life of Brigadier-General Adams.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |George Walters || British Army || 1854 || Crimean War || Inkerman
*George Walters – Sergeant in the 49th Foot who won the Victoria Cross at the Battle of Inkermann in 1854
